intro: Espostoa humboldtii, commonly known as the Humboldt's espostoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or arid soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
